p: The effectiveness of annually administered influenza vaccines relies on the selection of appropriate viruses that elicit optimal immunity against a wide range of influenza viruses circulating worldwide at that time [ 10, 11]. Along with classical antigenic characterization, based on serological assays, sequencing of specific virus genes has become an integral surveillance tool that contributes to vaccine selection [ 12]. Permanent monitoring of the antigenic and genetic properties of locally circulating influenza viruses will help in directing local/regional vaccine needs and allow the monitoring of the (re)emergence of variant virus strains.
